title: Rethinking luxury fashion : the role of cultural intelligence in creative strategy
subject: Luxury goods industry -- Marketing

branding

creator: Serdari, Thomaï, author.$$QSerdari, Thomaï
description: Using the field of material culture as its methodological departure point, this Palgrave Pivot explains the strategic advantages that brands can set in place when their executives are fully in command of how to move from strategy to tactics. Specifically, it studies the brands, their products and signature experiences as well as their relationship with the consumer in an attempt to define the greater powers that have pushed fashion labels in and out of fashion. It focuses on case analysis of specific luxury fashion brands and attempts to link those to the greater context of material culture while also elaborating on theoretical discussions. Bridging theory and practice, this book explores the relationship between creative strategy and cultural intelligence.
series: Palgrave Advances in Luxury$$QPalgrave Advances in Luxury
Palgrave advances in luxury.$$QPalgrave advances in luxury.
contents: Part I. Background of Luxury Fashion as a Field of Material Culture -- Defining Fashion, Luxury, and Luxury Fashion -- Established Methods of Classifying Luxury Fashion Brands -- A New Method for the Classification of Luxury Fashion Brands -- Part II. Production and Consumption of Luxury Fashion -- The Producers of "Newness" in Luxury Fashion -- What Do We Really Consume Through Luxury Fashion? -- How Do We Consume Luxury Fashion? -- Part III. Cultural Intelligence and Creativity -- A Close Look at Cultural Intelligence -- Cultural Hyperobjects -- Luxury Fashion Products Addressing Cultural Changes -- Luxury Marketing Strategies Based on Cultural Intelligence -- Part IV. The Future of Luxury Fashion -- Step by Step Application of the Framework.
relation: $$Cform$$VPrint version: Serdari, Thomaï. Rethinking Luxury Fashion. New York : Palgrave Macmillan, 2020$$QRethinking Luxury Fashion.

abstract: Using the field of material culture as its methodological departure point, this Palgrave Pivot explains the strategic advantages that brands can set in place when their executives are fully in command of how to move from strategy to tactics. Specifically, it studies the brands, their products and signature experiences as well as their relationship with the consumer in an attempt to define the greater powers that have pushed fashion labels in and out of fashion. It focuses on case analysis of specific luxury fashion brands and attempts to link those to the greater context of material culture while also elaborating on theoretical discussions. Bridging theory and practice, this book explores the relationship between creative strategy and cultural intelligence.
